title: Facebook, Citing Societal Concerns, Plans to Shut Down Facial Recognition System
content: Saying it wants “to find the right balance” with the technology, the social network will delete the face scan data of more than one billion users.

more_info.byline: By Kashmir Hill and Ryan Mac

title: John Deere workers reject a revised contract proposal, extending their strike.
content: Workers upset over insufficient wage increases and pension benefits have been on strike since mid-October.

title: As the Fed Prepares to Slow Support, Attention Shifts to Rate Increases
content: The Federal Reserve is expected to announce a plan to taper off its bond buying. With inflation surging, economists’ eyes are already turning to rates.

title: Corporate Climate Pledges Often Ignore a Key Component: Supply Chains
content: Many companies do not account for the emissions from their supply chains, which can be a significant majority of their contributions to greenhouse gases.

more_info.byline: By Michael Corkery and Julie Creswell
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Another Apple Worker Says the Company Retaliated Against Her
content: One of the leaders of an activist movement at Apple took her complaint to a federal agency, marking an escalation of a conflict between Apple and some of its workers.

title: How Car Shortages Are Putting the World’s Economy at Risk
content: Because so many jobs depend on automaking, the industry’s production problems are causing the pain to ripple.

more_info.byline: By Jack Ewing and Patricia Cohen

title: As Demand for Green Energy Grows, Solar Farms Face Local Resistance
content: Developers say industrial-scale farms are needed to meet the nation’s climate goals, but locals are fighting back against what they see as an encroachment on their pastoral settings.

title: How the Pandemic Has Added to Labor Unrest
content: While big companies wield considerable power, Covid’s economic disruption has given workers new leverage, contributing to a recent upturn in strikes.

org_facet: International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees

title: Europe Fears That Rising Cost of Climate Action Is Stirring Anger
content: Memories of the Yellow Vest movement are prompting officials to ensure that spiking energy prices don’t fuel inequality or populist discontent.

title: Big Warning Signs for the Biden Economic Agenda
content: Republican victories portend more trouble for Democrats’ legislative efforts.

more_info.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Jason Karaian, Sarah Kessler, Stephen Gandel, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni

title: New York Times Adds 455,000 Subscriptions in Third Quarter
content: After moving behind a paywall, Wirecutter added to the company’s revenue stream.

title: Global finance industry says it has $130 trillion to invest in efforts to tackle climate change.
content: The pledge would transform the international financial system, but critics say it falls short on fossil fuels.

more_info.byline: By Liz Alderman and Eshe Nelson
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Spain is facing the loss of a major source of natural gas.
content: Algeria, locked in a dispute with Morocco, has shut down a significant gas pipeline.

title: From BTS to ‘Squid Game’: How South Korea Became a Cultural Juggernaut
content: The country was once largely known for cars and smartphones, but a global audience has become mesmerized by its entertainment, and creators say success didn’t happen overnight.

title: In a ‘Workers Economy,’ Who Really Holds the Cards?
content: Some people are resigning. Some are sitting on the sidelines awaiting a prime gig. Others are flexing their muscles — requesting raises, or remote options — while still clocking in.

title: A Sinking Student Housing Empire
content: An ambitious property management company that pitches upscale off-campus apartments across the country has left tenants and investors stewing.

des_facet: Private Placements (Non-Public Offerings) and Mini IPOs

title: Attention, New Englanders: Fluffernutter Is Now a Word
content: What has prompted Merriam-Webster to add the longstanding term for a mostly regional sandwich to the dictionary?

title: A Chinese Tennis Star Accuses a Former Top Leader of Sexual Assault
content: Peng Shuai’s accusation against Zhang Gaoli takes the country’s budding #MeToo movement to the top echelons of the Communist Party for the first time.

title: C.D.C. Recommends Covid Vaccine for Younger Children
content: With the agency director’s sign-off, children ages 5 to 11 could begin to receive the shots this week.

org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Democrats Push for Agreement on Tax Deduction That Benefits the Rich
content: Lawmakers are coalescing around a deal to suspend a $10,000 cap on state and local tax deductions that was imposed during the Trump administration.

more_info.byline: By Emily Cochrane and Alan Rappeport

title: Meta Makes Changes to Marketing Strategy Amid Scandals
content: After the social media giant auditioned agencies to manage its ad budget, underscoring its Madison Avenue ties, Spark Foundry won the business.

more_info.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Davey Alba

title: Zillow, facing big losses, quits flipping houses and will lay off a quarter of its staff.
content: The real estate website had been relying on its algorithm that estimates home values to buy and resell homes. That part of its business lost about $420 million in three months.

title: Are You Missing Out on the Metaverse?
content: Pitches for the future of the internet are banking on an old trick: FOMO.

title: At the Radio City Christmas Show, Some Workers Worry About Covid Rules
content: Employees must all be vaccinated, but some are upset that the upcoming show is not also testing them for the virus, as is done on Broadway and at other major performing venues.

title: Pfizer’s Covid vaccine could break sales records again next year.
content: For two years in a row, the company is on track to bring in more single-year revenue from the shots than any other medical product in history.

title: The Mark Zuckerberg Aesthetic
content: With his plans for a virtual reality metaverse, the Facebook founder pitches himself as a cultural impresario of the internet’s future.

title: Widespread Coronavirus Infection Found in Iowa Deer, New Study Says
content: The analysis by Penn State and Iowa researchers strongly indicates that deer are getting the virus from humans, worrying experts about a deep wild reservoir for the virus.

title: Justice Dept. Sues Penguin Random House Over Simon & Schuster Deal
content: The Biden administration’s rejection of the proposed $2.18 billion publishing merger reflects a changing atmosphere in Washington toward consolidation.

more_info.byline: By Elizabeth A. Harris, Alexandra Alter and David McCabe

title: Opioid Makers Win Major Victory in California Trial
content: In one of the first cases to be brought against drug manufacturers over the crisis, a judge ruled that there was “simply no evidence” the companies were liable in the epidemic.

title: Elon Musk says Tesla has not signed a deal with Hertz yet.
content: Hertz had said that it would convert more than 20 percent of its rental fleet to Tesla’s cars, a deal that helped propel Tesla’s stock value beyond $1 trillion for the first time.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
content: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

more_info.byline: By Jordan Allen and Kristen Bayrakdarian

title: More same-sex couples may be eligible for Social Security survivor benefits.
content: Even after winning the right to marry across the U.S. more than six years ago, some same-sex couples have faced challenges obtaining certain benefits.

des_facet: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
org_facet: Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund

title: Regulators Sound the Alarm on Stablecoins
content: A fast-growing part of the cryptocurrency industry needs more oversight, the Treasury Department warns.

more_info.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Jason Karaian, Sarah Kessler, Stephen Gandel, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni

title: BP’s profit rises as oil and gas prices soar.
content: The London-based energy giant said it had benefited from reviving demand for oil and OPEC’s management of output.

org_facet: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
